result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keenen Michael Hill

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keenen Michael Hill in court, in custody.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court for Keenen Michael Hill.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status conference. Defense has withdrawn all pending motions.  In the event of global resolution with pending cases in Br. 36, this court will either accept transfer of this case to Br. 36 or will accept transfer of pending cases from Br 36.   Defense date for plea and sentencing be set. Case adjourned to Br. 9.   Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-26-22, filed.
Pretrial Services Status Report 10-24-22, filed.
Pursuant to Defense withdrawal of motion, the Evidentiary Hearing set for 10/27/2022 at 2:00 pm is reverted to Status Conference on same date/time
Defendant's Withdrawal of Motion, filed.
Pursuant to request from Defense counsel, and with Court approval and agreement of the parties, the Motion hearing set for 9/1/2022 at 2 pm is rescheduled to 10/27/2022 at 2 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-31-22, filed.
/from Attorney Amy Spanczak dated 8/31/2022, filed
State's Response to Defense's Motion to Suppress Evidence.  Received and Filed.  nk
State's Response Brief to Defense's Motion to Compel or Dismiss.  Received and Filed.  nk
Exhibit 1 for Motion to Compel.  Received and Filed.  nk
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (8 pages) commencing 04-01-22 by DANIELLE HOLCOMB.

Defendant Keenen Michael Hill in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  John J Rejowski appeared for Amy Spanczak for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Court in receipt of motions from the defense.  Court set the following filing deadlines with parties. State has until July 1st, 2022, to file a response to the motion. Defense has until August 1st, 2022, to file a reply to the State's response. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-2-2022
22RM025714  Actual Date Bond Posted with *SHERIFFS 5/19/2022
Court increases signature bond to $3,000.00 cash bail. All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

SPIN:
Defendant Keenen Michael Hill in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail/Bond hearing held. Presiding Judge unavailable due to unexpected travel delays. For reasons stated on the record, Court increases bail to $3,000.00 cash. Defendant taken into custody. Case remains set for Pre-trial conference on 6/3/22, at 10:15 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-13-2022
Court in receipt of a JusticePoint violation report. Court scheduled a bail bond hearing with parties via email. Next court date is a bail bond hearing on May 16th, 2022 at 8:15 am.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Pretrial Services Violation Report 5-5-2022
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Defendant's Motion to Compel
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Defendant's Motion to Suppress Evidence

Defendant Keenen Michael Hill in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Parties before the court for scheduling.  Court set deadline for State to provide Discovery (with the exception of crime lab report), to 4/29  the deadline to file motions or if there is a change of  plea, all paperwork should be filed by 5/31; The next court appearance in Br 17 will be for a continued pre trial conference.  mn  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4-14-2022, Filed.

Defendant Keenen Michael Hill in court with Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 07CF1133. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer T. Miller. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4-1-2022, Filed.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.
Pretrial Services Violation Report 3-23-2022, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Keenen Michael Hill in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Keenen Michael Hill in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keenen Michael Hill appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
